items.sentence: I don't think many people can say they're satisfied with their salary.
Tom said that he wasn't used to working in adverse weather conditions.
Tom is at an age where he should be able to use the toilet by himself.
I was afraid I wasn't going to be able to find my way out of the cave.
Tom had trouble believing Mary would actually want to go out with him.
There's a guy standing outside the polling station threatening people.
I found his new novel very dull. I don't think he is much of a writer.
No matter how hard he may work, he will not be able to pass the exams.
They asked me what my name was, where I came from, and why I had come.
She looked in her bag for the key of the house, but could not find it.
